amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to expanding United States counter-propaganda communications to combat misinformation from the Russian Federation or terrorist groups like ISIS and al Qaeda.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1005 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 1005 proposed by Senator Sanders for Senator Murphy. (consideration: CR S1998; text: CR S1998) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to expanding United States counter-propaganda communications to combat misinformation from the Russian Federation or terrorist groups like ISIS and al Qaeda.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1005 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1005 proposed by Senator Sanders for Senator Murphy.
